activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary M. Cooke

records.addlTxt:
3:15 PM 2022CF000069, 2022CF000103, 2022CF000134, 2022CM000110 - Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Zachary M. Cooke.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

 2022CF000134- Attorney Christian provides the court with the preliminary hearing waiver form. Court goes over the waiver and binds over for trial. Attorney Harper states that she has just filed the information. Attorney Christian waives the formal reading and stand mute. 

2022CF000103-  Court speaks about the motion to be forfeited. State asks for the motion to be held in advance. Court holds the motion in advance.

Attorney Christian asks for a status.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:46 AM 2022CF000103, 2022CF000134, 2022CM000110, 2022CF000069 - Defendant Zachary M. Cooke in court, in custody.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Zachary M. Cooke.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.

22CF134 - Attorney Christian waives the formal reading and asks for a preliminary hearing is this case. Max penalties stated. Attorney Christian heard about probation hold. Attorney Christian waives the time limits of the preliminary hearing. 

 22CF103 -Court speaks about motion that was filed. Attorney Harper states that there is a motion to forfeit bond and references statue. Attorney Christian asks that the court hold the motion open. Court resets the motion hearing at the time of the preliminary hearing.
Motion hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:03 PM Unfiled, 22CF69, 22CF103, 22CM110 - Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Zachary M. Cooke.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Harper asks for a $1500 cash on the unfiled case.
No contact with KAC or MMC which includes their residence, place of employment or any place temporary occupied by them.

Attorney Harper speaks about modifying the cash bond on 22CF103 to $1500. Attorney Christian asks to see a motion.

Attorney Christian heard and states that his client is on a probation hold. Attorney Christian asks for a signature bond.
Attorney Harpers speaks about the victim residence.

Court orders:
$ 1500 cash bond

Initial set for 09/30/22 at 9:30 AM.

Court will hold the motion to advance bond in 22CF103.
Attorney Harper withdraw the motion to advance bond.

Court will set all cases for 09/30/22. 22CF130 will be scheduled for a motion to revoke.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Attachments to motion to forfeit cash bond

10:37 AM 22CF69/ 22CF103 / 22CM110 - Defendant Zachary M. Cooke in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Zachary M. Cooke.  Attorney Forehand on behalf of Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christian states that he hasn't received and off and asks for a set over but first would like to speak about bond.

Attorney Christian provides the court with an email corresponds with DOC that indicate that  if release ZC would be on supervision. Discussion about charges and bond. Attorney Christian requests a signature bond instead of cash bond in 22CF103. Attorney Forehand objects to a $500 signature bond since ZC has picked up on new cases while he was on probation. Attorney Christian comments. Discussion.

Court speaks about drug court for ZC. ZC hasn't read up on drug court. Court encourages Attorney Christian and ZC to look into and apply for drug court.

Court lowers his bail to $300 cash.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:01 AM 22CF69/ 22CF103 and 22CM110 - Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Zachary M. Cooke.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christian has provided the court the waiver of the preliminary hearing in 22CF69 and 22CF103. Court speaks about the wavier of the preliminary hearing. ZC concurs. Court binds over. Parties agree to move forward with the arraignment. State will be filing the information bring forth the same charges. Attorney Christian enters a NG plea on all counts. Court advises the clerk to enters the NG on both CF cases.

Attorney Christian speaks about a bond reduction prior to the September 13 date due to a possible bed for ZC. Attorney Harper comments.

Attorney Harper asks for a status.

22CM110 - Attorney Christian waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea on all counts. Max penalties stated.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Harper appears in person. Attorney Christian appears in person . ZC appears by video from the jail. Attorney Harper has filed the complaint but hasn't been received by the clerk of court. Max penalties stated. ZC comments. Attorney Christian states that he request a preliminary hearing within 20 days. Preliminary hearing set for 08/18/22 at 9 AM. Attorney Christian comments about the safety of the defendant in the Richland County Jail.

1:24 PM Defendant Zachary Cooke in court, in custody. Attorney Harper appears for the state. Attorney Christian appears in person.
State heard and asks for $5,000 cash bond.
Attorney Christian asks for a signature bond since he is on a probation hold.
Court orders a $500 cash bond.

Initial set for 08/08/22 at 3 PM
